    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void adrenalineManager(Controller currentController, Player player)
      this method enables the adrenaline modes in the player boards of a given player
      private static void adrenalineReset(Controller currentController, Player player)
      this method deactivates both adrenaline modes for players that have died and also resets their damage tracks
      private static java.util.ArrayList<Player> checkForDamage(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersBefore, java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersAfter)
      returns a list of the players damaged during this macroaction
      static java.util.ArrayList<Player> choiceExecutor(Controller currentController, ChosenActions actions)
      this method applies the player's choices for the Macro Action it requested
      static void damageDealer(Controller currentController, Player target, char[] damageToDeal)
      This method deals damage to the player it receives as a parameter Note: the damage must be dealt BEFORE the marks
      (package private) static void dealPoints(Controller currentController, int boardValue, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> offendersList)
      this deals the points on a board (no killshot and or overkill management)
      static void getCardsToSpawn(boolean setUpGame, Controller controller, int id) 
      (package private) static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> listOffenders(char[] damage)
      this method builds a list of the players char colors by the number of damage they've given (See tests for example) It also considers the tie breaker in favour of the player that hit first
      static void markerDealer(Controller currentController, Player target, char[] add)
      this method adds new marks to a player's player board
      static void payGunCardCost(Player player, char[] cost, boolean pickOrFullReload)
      method that allows the player to pay the ammocost for a weapon
      static void reloadManager(Player player, boolean[] reload)
      method that allows to recharge weapons
      private static char scoreSingleBoard(Controller currentController, PlayerBoard board)
      this method scores the single PlayerBoard, dealing points Points dealt: - first blood: 1 point - (first) player with most damage: boardvalue points update of killshot track: - 1 damage token of color of player that dealt the killshot; 2 if it dealt also overkill Note: a kill happens on the 11th damage given : 1 token on the KST; : the board gets scored at the end of the turn Note: an overkill happens on the 12th damage given : double token on the KST; you get a mark from the player you overkilled Note: in frenzy, boards in frenzy mode do not offer first blood points
      static void scoringProcess(Controller currentController)
      This method scores all of the boards at the end of a turn Note: more than one killshot in one turn : awards you a point
      static void spawnPlayers(Controller controller, int id, PowerupCard spawn)
      method that allows to spawn players in the right spawn point

    • Method Detail

      • scoringProcess

        public static void scoringProcess(Controller currentController)
        This method scores all of the boards at the end of a turn Note: more than one killshot in one turn : awards you a point

      • scoreSingleBoard

        private static char scoreSingleBoard(Controller currentController,
                                     PlayerBoard board)
        this method scores the single PlayerBoard, dealing points Points dealt: - first blood: 1 point - (first) player with most damage: boardvalue points update of killshot track: - 1 damage token of color of player that dealt the killshot; 2 if it dealt also overkill Note: a kill happens on the 11th damage given : 1 token on the KST; : the board gets scored at the end of the turn Note: an overkill happens on the 12th damage given : double token on the KST; you get a mark from the player you overkilled Note: in frenzy, boards in frenzy mode do not offer first blood points
        Parameters:
        board - is the board to score

      • dealPoints

        static void dealPoints(Controller currentController,
                       int boardValue,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> offendersList)
        this deals the points on a board (no killshot and or overkill management)
        Parameters:
        boardValue - is the value of the board to score
        offendersList - is the list of offenders ordered by number of damages inflicted

      • listOffenders

        static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> listOffenders(char[] damage)
        this method builds a list of the players char colors by the number of damage they've given (See tests for example) It also considers the tie breaker in favour of the player that hit first
        Parameters:
        damage - is the damageTrack

        public static void spawnPlayers(Controller controller,
                                int id,
                                PowerupCard spawn)
                         throws CardNotFoundException
        method that allows to spawn players in the right spawn point
        Parameters:
        controller -
        id - player id
        spawn - color that indicates the spawn point
        Throws:

                                                         ChosenActions actions)
        this method applies the player's choices for the Macro Action it requested
        Parameters:

        actions - contains the choices

      • damageDealer

        public static void damageDealer(Controller currentController,
                                Player target,
                                char[] damageToDeal)
        This method deals damage to the player it receives as a parameter Note: the damage must be dealt BEFORE the marks
        Parameters:
        damageToDeal - array of chars that contain the damage as characters representing the color of the offender. Note that the damage drops "to be dealt" here come from a single player.
